title: Luckslinger
description:
In Luckslinger, luck is measurable, collectable and usable whenever you please.

On one half itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s inspired by the unrealistically fast gunslingers, the dark gritty humor and the greed driven anti-heroes of the spaghetti western classics.

On the other half itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s inspired by vinyl digging, graffiti spraying, rhyming and the slow drums and jazzy samples of hip hop culture and sound.

Do you feel lucky? Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Kill bandits, steal their luck and use it for your own good. The more luck you have the more chance you have that, enemy bullets might miss, you get saved from a bad jump or better loot is dropped in front of your feet. However, when you donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have much luck in your lucky bracelet, bridges might collapse, rocks might come loose and outlaws might find a way to get a jump on you.
These are just a few examples of how luck affects your quest for fortune.

Clovercreek and the crazy outlaws Ã¢â‚¬â€œ The town of Clovercreek has been robbed blind. Six infamous criminals stole the townÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s precious luck charms and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s up to you to bring them back. Get paid the golden price while doing so, because bounty hunters donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t do charity work.
